items.text: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

items.text: In the LORD put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?
items.plainText: In the LORD put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?

items.text: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.
items.plainText: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.

items.text: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?
items.plainText: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?

items.text: The LORD is in his holy temple, the LORD's throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.
items.plainText: The LORD is in his holy temple, the LORD's throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.

items.text: The LORD trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.
items.plainText: The LORD trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.

items.text: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.
items.plainText: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.

items.text: For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.
items.plainText: For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.
